item.title: Light not working, 24th December
item.description:
Burtwell Lane at the Clive Road entrance. Light mounted on the side wall of 27 Clive Road is still not working. It is extremely dark and feels very unsafe. Previously reported a month ago. May come under estate lighting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Burtwell Lane, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Broken curb, 24th December
item.description:
Under Section 41 of the Highways Act 1980, the Bexley Council has a statutory duty to maintain the public highway to a safe standard. The defect was previously reported and supposed to of been fixed. However, the repair was of such poor quality that it failed almost immediately. A patch and go approach that does not address the structural integrity of the curb constitutes a failure to perform a competent repair. The council was aware of the defect. By performing a substandard repair, the council has actively created a trap for road users rather than resolving the hazard. I will be further supporting our claims in a formal complaint seeking compensation for the 2 damage tyres once repaired and if my complaint is not upheld I will be forwarding my evidence to the Ombudsman

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing Fly-tipping at the End of Briset Road, 24th December
item.description:
Dear Royal Borough of Greenwich Council, I am writing to formally report a long-standing and ongoing fly-tipping issue at the end of Briset Road. This problem has persisted for several years and has now reached an unacceptable level. Individuals routinely dump large items of furniture as well as daily household waste in this area. Despite occasional clearances, the dumping continues without interruption, causing rubbish to accumulate repeatedly. The situation has become unbearable for local residents and presents serious concerns regarding public health, environmental damage, and the general safety and cleanliness of the neighbourhood. The continued failure to prevent or adequately address this issue has had a significant negative impact on residentsâ€™ quality of life. The area is regularly left in an unsanitary and unsightly condition, attracting further dumping and anti-social behaviour. I urge the Council to take immediate and effective action to resolve this matter permanently. This may include increased enforcement, monitoring, preventative measures, and any other steps necessary to stop illegal dumping at this location. Temporary clean-ups alone are clearly insufficient, given the long history of this problem. I would appreciate confirmation that this report has been received and information on what actions will be taken to address this ongoing issue. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Briset Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
